name: The Pcr Song
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
[Chords]
[ch]D5[/ch]   xx023x
[ch]D5[/ch]*  xx003x

[Intro]
e|------------15-14-15-|-12---15------15------|--------------------15-|-12---------14----------|
B|-------0-------------|---------15------13---|-12--------12-13-15----|---------------15-------|
G|-----0---------------|----------------------|--------14-------------|------12-14-------14-12-|
D|---0-----------------|----------------------|-----------------------|------------------------|
A|---------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|------------------------|
E|-3-------------------|----------------------|-----------------------|------------------------|

[Verse]
[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D/F#[/ch]        [ch]Em[/ch]
There was a time when to amplify DNA,
    [ch]Am7[/ch]                  [ch]G/B[/ch]          [ch]D/F#[/ch]
You had to grow tons and tons of tiny cells.
     [ch]Bm[/ch]                     [ch]Am7[/ch]       [ch]G/B[/ch]   [ch]D/F#[/ch]
Then along came a guy named Dr. Kary Mullis,
             [ch]Am7[/ch]             [ch]G/B[/ch]           [ch]D/F#[/ch]
Said you can amplify in vitro just as well.

     [ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]D/F#[/ch]            [ch]Em[/ch]
Just mix your template with a buffer and some primers,
[ch]Am7[/ch]               [ch]G/B[/ch]          [ch]D/F#[/ch]
Nucleotides and polymerases, too.
  [ch]Bm[/ch]            [ch]Am7[/ch]           [ch]G/B[/ch]    [ch]D/F#[/ch]
Denaturing, annealing, and extending.
           [ch]Am7[/ch]                     [ch]G/B[/ch]          [ch]D/F#[/ch]
Well it’s amazing what heating and cooling and heating will do.

[Chorus]
[ch]D5[/ch]* [ch]D5[/ch]  [ch]G[/ch]           [ch]D/F#[/ch]             [ch]Em[/ch]
P   C   R, when you need to detect mutations.
  [ch]Am7[/ch]         [ch]G/B[/ch]          [ch]D/F#[/ch]
PCR, when you need to recombine.
  [ch]Bm[/ch]          [ch]Am7[/ch]                      [ch]G/B[/ch]      [ch]D/F#[/ch]
PCR, when you need to find out who the daddy is.
  [ch]Am7[/ch]         [ch]G/B[/ch]             [ch]D/F#[/ch]
PCR, when you need to solve a crime.

[ch]F#m[/ch]                 [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]Bm[/ch]     
Lui non aveva super processori soltanto 16 colori 
[ch]F#m[/ch]               [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Bm[/ch]
Non lo capivano i genitori lo sconsigliavano i professori 
[ch]F#m[/ch]                     [ch]D[/ch]                   [ch]Bm[/ch]
Lo attaccavi al televisore e ore e ore a caricare giochi dal registratore 
[ch]F#m[/ch]                      [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]Bm[/ch]
La grafica mancava di definizione ma la sostituiva l'immaginazione 
[ch]D[/ch]                      [ch]E[/ch]
La tua adolescenza con solo un joystick 
[ch]F#m[/ch]                       [ch]E[/ch]                [ch]D[/ch]
Ma nessun scooter andrà più veloce di quella BMX 
[ch]A[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]

[ch]A[/ch]             [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]E[/ch]

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                             Le joueur PC - Usul (3615)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tabbed by: Sotomaru

Tuning: regular
La musique est tirée de cette vidéo : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-YLxkXtzTdM
N'ayant pas trouvé les accords en voulant reprendre ce beau pastiche de Brassens, 
je vous les ai notés, au cas où. Vous aussi, vous pourrez désormais briller au coin d'un feu.

Intro
        [ch]Dm[/ch]
e|-----------------------------------|
B|--------5---5----5---5---5--5----5-|
G|--------7---7----7---7---7--7----7-|
D|--------7---7----7---7---7--7----7-|
A|----4-5-------5--------5-------5---|
E|5-7-------5--------5-------5-------|

        [ch]Dm[/ch]
e|---------------------------------------|
B|--------5---5----5---5---5--5----5---5-|
G|--------7---7----7---7---7--7----7---7-|
D|--------7---7----7---7---7--7----7---7-|
A|----4-5-------5--------5-------5-------|
E|5-7-------5--------5-------5-------5---|

Verse

   [ch]Dm[/ch]                [ch]A[/ch]         [ch]Dm[/ch]            [ch]D[/ch]
Heureux qui, dans sa chambre, a de l'informatique
    [ch]G[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]                    [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]
entrepris de comprendre toutes les mécaniques

      [ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]A[/ch]        [ch]Dm[/ch]           [ch]D[/ch]
De sa science insolente, déjà, jeune Artaban
     [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]                  [ch]F[/ch]   [ch]A[/ch]
Il parade et se vante, se voyant surplombant 

      [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]            [ch]C[/ch]            [ch]F[/ch]
Loin du haut de sa tour, les menues contingences
     [ch]Bb[/ch]         [ch]D#[/ch]                     [ch]A[/ch]
Des bêtes de labour que l'extrême indigence

    [ch]D[/ch]                 [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]C[/ch]             [ch]F[/ch]
A poussé, c'est trop con, à s'asseoir sur le sol
     [ch]Bb[/ch]       [ch]D#[/ch]                          [ch]A[/ch]
A jouer au salon, pauvres joueurs de consoles...


Il manque la notation de quelques fioritures dans le corps du couplet, mais je n'ai pas eu la patience
de les retranscrire ici. En gros, il faut reprendre le doigté de l'intro. 

La chanson est pertinente, l'imitation n'est pas grossière, c'est vraiment du beau travail ! Merci le 3615.

Chemistry- PCM

!This is our first song, hope you enjoy it!

Chords :
[ch]E[/ch] :  xx122x
[ch]G#m[/ch] : 222442
[ch]A[/ch]: x333xx
[ch]Am[/ch]: x122xx

Strumming Pattern:Down   Down  Mute.  Down Up Down   Mute.

Verse:

[ch]E[/ch]                                                   [ch]G#m[/ch]
Look in your surroundings baby,  look all-a-around you baby,
[ch]A[/ch]                                                   [ch]E[/ch]
Is there any place where elements- aren’t found…
[ch]E[/ch]
Be it the oxygen in the atmosphere, which helps support the biosphere,
[ch]A[/ch]                                    [ch]E[/ch]
Or the noble neon light, which makes our world so nice and bright and-


[ch]Am[/ch]                                         [ch]E[/ch]
Ooooooooooooh,                  Can’t you see,
[ch]G#m[/ch]                                             [ch]A[/ch]
Chemistry,    has already made history .      and-
 [ch]Am[/ch]                                         [ch]E[/ch]
Ooooh-ah-ah,  ooooh-ah-ah,   Ooooh-ah-ah, oooh-ah-ah,
[ch]G#m[/ch]                                             [ch]A[/ch]
Ooooh-ah-ah,  ooooh-ah-ah,   Ooooh-ah-ah, oooh-ah-ah.

Verse
(same chord progression)

Then there’s the periodic table, elements active or stable,
Hydrogen and helium, the powerful uranium.
There are valences of one, our very own hydrogen,
Then there’s valences of two, our super strong calcium.

Chorus
(given above, remains the same)

Verse
(same chord progression)

Before English, long ago, there were names that we don’t know,
Ferrum’s iron, leads plumbum, silver is argentinum.
Scientists, latin or greek, worked and researched for weeks and weeks,
And thus these geniuses were able, to form our periodic table.


Chorus
(given above, remains the same)

 e:  -----5---------4--------3----------2----------1-|
 a:  --------0---------0---------0----------0------1-|
 g:  --5---------4--------3-----------2------------0-|
 d:  ------------------------------------------------|
 b:  ------------------------------------------------|
*e:  ------------------------------------------------|


And all these elements are able, and found in our very own periodic table.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Thank- You.

For suggestions: rishabh. prakash@yahoo.com
